materials.title: 2022年12月大学英语四级听力真题第2套
materials.transcript: 本听力测试包含三个部分：A部分为新闻报道听力，B部分为对话听力，C部分为短文听力。各部分均有相应的题目和选项。

questions.question: What event will take place in Glasgow?
options: A. A free car show.
B. A yearly concert.
C. A sports competition.
D. A pipe band contest.
questions.explanation: 新闻中提到在格拉斯哥将举行世界风笛乐队锦标赛(World Pipe Band Championships)。

questions.question: What does Glasgow City Council say the event will do?
options: A. Improve the image of Glasgow city.
B. Enrich the local culture of Glasgow.
C. Contribute a lot to the local economy.
D. Entertain people in local communities.
questions.explanation: 新闻中提到格拉斯哥市议会表示，该活动预计将为当地经济带来30万英镑的收入。

questions.question: What is scientists' warning in the news report?
options: A. Surprising rise in global sea levels.
B. Dangerous ice melts in Greenland.
C. Changing weather patterns in summer.
D. Record growth of Greenland's ice sheets.
questions.explanation: 新闻中科学家警告格陵兰岛正在发生危险的冰层融化(dangerous ice melts)。

questions.question: What do we learn about this year's ice melting season in Greenland?
options: A. It began in late May.
B. It lasted three months.
C. It started a month earlier than usual.
D. It ended a month earlier than before.
questions.explanation: 新闻中提到今年融冰季节在5月初就开始了，比正常情况提前了一个月(a month earlier than normal)。

questions.question: What happened on the streets of Blackhall Colliery?
options: A. Bundles of £20 notes kept turning up.
B. A villager was searching for his lost cash.
C. Local policemen came across bundles of £20 notes.
D. A bundle containing thousands of pounds got stolen.
questions.explanation: 新闻中提到在Blackhall Colliery的街道上不断出现成捆的20英镑钞票(Bundles containing thousands of pounds in cash keep turning up)。

questions.question: What do the local police do with the money if not claimed in two weeks?
options: A. They give it to charity.
B. They return it to the finder.
C. They hand it over to the local government.
D. They place a notice in The Northern Echo.
questions.explanation: 新闻中提到如果两周内无人认领，钱会归还给发现者(returned to the finder)。

questions.question: What did the policeman John Forster say about the villagers?
options: A. They cooperated well with the police.
B. They enjoyed a fairly affluent life.
C. They were puzzled by the mystery.
D. They had a strong community spirit.
questions.explanation: 警察John Forster提到村民们立即想到将钱交给警察局，这表明了他们强烈的社区精神(community spirit)。

questions.question: How does the man often feel on his birthday?
options: A. Excited.
B. Delighted.
C. Indifferent.
D. Strange.
questions.explanation: 对话中男士说他在生日时常常感到奇怪(strange)。

questions.question: What does the woman say many people tend to do on their birthday?
options: A. Search for the meaning of their life.
B. Look back on their years at school.
C. Call on their relatives and friends.
D. Talk about future plans with friends.
questions.explanation: 女士提到许多人在生日时开始寻找自己存在的意义(search for the meaning of their existence)。

questions.question: What does the man say about birthday celebrations?
options: A. He prefers to have them shown on social media.
B. He loves them but does not want to make a fuss.
C. He enjoys celebrating others' birthdays rather than his own.
D. He looks forward to receiving presents from his close friends.
questions.explanation: 男士说他喜欢庆祝朋友的生日，但不喜欢自己成为关注的中心(I have wonderful friends and I love celebrating their birthdays. But I don't like being the center of attention)。

questions.question: What does the woman suggest the man do about his birthday celebration at the end of the conversation?
options: A. Hold it on a modest scale to remove birthday anxieties.
B. View it as a chance for people to socialize and have fun.
C. Extend invitation to those he trusts most.
D. Make it an occasion to collect donations.
questions.explanation: 对话结束时，女士建议男士将生日视为一个让人们聚在一起娱乐的机会(see your birthday as an opportunity to bring people together for them to have fun)。

questions.question: What does the woman say about her subway ride?
options: A. It was absolutely exhausting.
B. There was a terrible smell.
C. There was too long a delay.
D. She got off at the wrong station.
questions.explanation: 女士说地铁非常拥挤，她几乎无法移动，很难呼吸，当她到站时已经筋疲力尽(totally exhausted)。

questions.question: Why hasn't the woman got her own car?
options: A. She hasn't saved enough money.
B. She is worried about traffic jams.
C. She hasn't passed the driving test yet.
D. She is used to taking public transport.
questions.explanation: 女士说她有驾照，但正在攒钱买车，现在对她来说还有点贵，需要一段时间才能攒够钱(it'll take a while before I have enough money)。

questions.question: What does the woman say about electric motorbikes?
options: A. They are popular.
B. They are dangerous.
C. They are a bit expensive for her.
D. They are environmentally friendly.
questions.explanation: 女士说她见过太多涉及电动摩托车的可怕事故，称它们为危险的怪物(dangerous monsters)。

questions.question: How was the woman going to get to work?
options: A. By bus.
B. By jogging.
C. By renting a bike.
D. By sharing a ride.
questions.explanation: 对话最后，女士决定下载拼车应用(ride sharing app)，表明她打算通过拼车方式上班。

questions.question: What do we learn about Steve Miller?
options: A. He is a sign language interpreter.
B. He is a deaf person working in IT.
C. He doesn't like speaking at meetings.
D. He doesn't use email or text messages.
questions.explanation: 短文开头介绍Steve Miller是一名聋人，在IT行业工作(Being a deaf person in tech)。

questions.question: What does Miller say is making things better for people like him?
options: A. Improved communication skills.
B. Speech recognition technology.
C. Big advances in sign language.
D. Transformation in the IT industry.
questions.explanation: Miller提到语音识别技术的重大进步(Big advances in speech recognition technology)使通信工具能够实时将语音转换为文本。

questions.question: In what way can Miller benefit from attending meetings via video?
options: A. He can avoid being mistaken.
B. He can take notes on the spot.
C. He can understand with ease.
D. He can see the speakers' images.
questions.explanation: Miller说通过视频参加会议使他不再担心能否理解内容，可以专注于会议的内容(He no longer has to worry about whether or not he can understand)。

questions.question: What do people want upon returning home according to the passage?
options: A. To find pure white walls shining.
B. To enter a house well looked after.
C. To get a hug from family members.
D. To see cheerful colours all around.
questions.explanation: 短文提到人们回家时想看到能让他们振奋起来并给予拥抱的颜色(they want to see colours that cheer them up and give them a hug)。

questions.question: What does the passage say people should avoid doing in home decoration?
options: A. Choosing a colour because it is fashionable.
B. Painting the interior of their cupboards.
C. Doing the painting job all by themselves.
D. Designing all window frames the same way.
questions.explanation: 短文建议人们不要因为一种颜色流行或在杂志上看到就选择它(Don't go for a colour because it's in fashion, or you've seen it in a magazine)。

questions.question: What can one do to make a room look bigger?
options: A. Fit most of the cupboards into walls.
B. Hang landscape paintings all around.
C. Match the room's ceiling with all the furniture in colour.
D. Paint the wooden frameworks and walls the same colour.
questions.explanation: 短文提到将木质框架与墙壁涂成相同的颜色可以使房间看起来更大(painting the wooden frameworks the same colour as the walls, helping the rooms look bigger)。

questions.question: What does the passage say parents increasingly understand?
options: A. Children must read at least 3 times a week.
B. Reading is a habit every child can develop.
C. Reading to their children is important.
D. Children should start reading at age 3.
questions.explanation: 短文开头提到父母经常听说给孩子读书对支持发展至关重要，而且这个信息正在传达给他们(Parents often hear that reading to their children is critical for supporting development, and the message is getting through to them)。

questions.question: What can predict children's reading skills according to recent research?
options: A. The number of books they have read by age four.
B. The speed of their brain development in infancy.
C. The number and quality of books parents read to them in infancy.
D. The quality and quantity of time parents spend playing with them.
questions.explanation: 短文提到最近的研究发现，婴儿期共享阅读的质量和数量可以预测以后儿童的词汇和阅读技能(both the quality and quantity of shared book reading in infancy predicted later childhood vocabulary and reading skills)。

questions.question: What kind of books are said to help babies learn more?
options: A. Books with specifically labeled images.
B. Books with pictures of dolls and toys.
C. Books describing the lives of animals.
D. Books telling very interesting stories.
questions.explanation: 短文提到当父母给婴儿看有脸部或具有特定标签的物体的书籍时，他们学习得更多(when parents showed babies books that had faces or objects with specific labels, they learned more)。

questions.question: What are parents advised to do at the end of the passage?
options: A. Read as many books as possible to their children.
B. Choose carefully what to read to their children.
C. Share experience with other parents.
D. Create picture books for their children.
questions.explanation: 短文结尾建议父母需要非常谨慎地选择与孩子分享的书籍(parents need to choose the books they share with their children with great care)。

vocabulary.example: The World Pipe Band Championships will take place in Glasgow on Saturday.
Scientists are already sounding the alarm about dangerous ice melts going on right now in Greenland.
Bundles containing thousands of pounds in cash keep turning up on the streets.
It's not entirely unusual to feel anxious or sad around your birthday.
When I got to my station, I was totally exhausted.
Big advances in speech recognition technology have enabled communication tools to turn live speech into text.
